questions.optionc: concentrates power only at the centre
questions.optiond: allows the component units to secede at will

questions.question: Which of the following is an advantage of monocephalous executive ___________
A major difference between power and authority is that, authority is ________
Political participation can take the form of __________
questions.optionb: being a member of a pressure group

questions.question: Which of the following is a disadvantage of proportional representation?
questions.optionc: makes for easy decision making in parliament
questions.optiond: is difficult and cumbersome to operate

questions.question: The sum total of authority in a state unrestrained by law is _______
The flexibility and rigidity of constitution refer to the __________

The right to respect the personality of the individual is a _________

The following are redresses available at the courts for aggrieved people except _________
Which of the following usually leads to the curtailment of the rights of citizens?
The national secretariat of a political party is managed by the ________
The type of election which allows party members to elect candidates for elective offices is _________
An opposition party which sees itself as ''government -in-waiting'' is called ______
The document which sets out the programme of a political party and guides the electorate to vote for it is the ________
An advantage of a two-party system is that it __________
questions.optiond: protects the electorate from votr buying

questions.question: Which of the following is a non-partisan organization with the aim of influencing government policies?
The collective views held by majority of citizens of a country about a particular policy is _________

The following are means of controlling public corporation except _________

If a winner emerges in an election as a result of his/her votes being more than the combined votes of the opposing contestants; what types of electoral system is being practised?
Which of the following is a function of an electoral commission?
questions.optionc: disciplining personnel in the civil service

questions.question: Which of the following is not an electoral malpratice?
Local government sources of revenue can best be improved through?

questions.optiona: helps political parties to assess their policies
questions.optionb: creates delays in the execution of policies
questions.optiond: can be manipulated by political opponents

questions.question: One of the features of pressure groups is that all members ________

questions.optiona: The change in name of their culture
questions.optionb: The refusal of the African to be culturally colonized
questions.optionc: The paternal policy of the French
questions.optiond: Bribery of the opinion leaders by the French

questions.question: The capital of the French Federation of West Africa states was located in?
Under the crown colony system of administration, major policies were implemented in the colonies by the ________
questions.optionb: Secretary of states for the colonies

questions.question: One way of improving productivity in the public service is through?
Which of the following made the colonial Government a " Virtual Dictator"?

questions.optiona: Elevation of the position of the chiefs

questions.question: The African Union is most often unable to resolve conflicts because of _________

questions.optiona: encourages infringement on the territories of other states
questions.optionc: stimulates political activities in the state
questions.optiond: promotes understanding between the leaders and the led

questions.question: The West African Students Union (WASU) was formed by _______

questions.optionc: breaking of diplomatic relations with foreign countries
